Discuss how   βdc changes with temperature\.

 _I_   C  :  dc collector current

 _V_   BE  :  dc voltage at base with respect to emitter

 _V_   CB  :  dc voltage at collector with respect to base

 _V_   CE  :  dc voltage at collector with respect to emitter

# Bipolar Junction Transistor ( BJT)

Collector Curve Characteristics:

A set of  collector characteristic curves can be generated that show how the collector current\,  $I_C$\, varies with the collector\-to\-emitter voltage\,  _V_ CE\, for specified values of base current\,  _I_ B\.

Note in the circuit diagram that both  _V_ BB and  _V_ CC are variable sources of voltage\.

![](l4.2-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis-img/l42-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis_18.png)

Collector Curve Characteristics:

Regions of operation  of the transistor:

_  Saturation_

_  Active _

_ Cut\-off region _

_ _  Breakdown Region

![](l4.2-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis-img/l42-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis_19.jpg)

Is the nonconducting state of a transistor\.

when  _I_ B = 0\, the transistor is in the cut\-off region of its operation\.

![](l4.2-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis-img/l42-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis_20.png)

 __Saturation Region:__ 

Saturation: the collector current has reached a  maximum.

![](l4.2-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis-img/l42-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis_21.png)

The bottom of the load line is at ideal cut\-off  where IC = 0 and VCE = VCC\.

The top of the load line is at saturation where:

 I    C     = I    C    \(sat\)    = VCC/RC

 V    CE     = V    CE    \(sat\)\.  

![](l4.2-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis-img/l42-bipolar-junction-transistor-circuit-analysis_22.png)
